content.description: Endurance, endurance, endurance. Panels vary and depending on figure size you may want to tape your cuticles. It's long but moves are no harder than a V3. Some panels have dirt, plants and/or spiders in the cracks. Bring a rag or broom as your weapon.

Everything is fairly consistent but gaps do vary a little. Depending on finger size you may want to tape cuticles. You will have to sling a tree for an anchor and watch that the rope does not run over the concrete gap at the top.
content.protection: Sling a tree at the top by the highway.
content.location: Hop on the Cross Seminole Trail and find your way to mile marker 1.75.

content.description: Area under 417 Highway that's built out of formed concrete panels stacked about 40' tall for a 5.9 climb which you'll have to sling a tree for an anchor or you can traverse about 500' along the wall with moves no harder than a V3.
